full_text:
Re: Media inquiry - NY1 - re: Epstein hearing tomorrow
From: Lee Plourde
To: [redacted]
Date: 2019/07/30 15:36
Subject: Re: Media inquiry - NY1 - re: Epstein hearing tomorrow
Attachments: TEXT.htm
Thank you.
Sent from my Verizon, Samsung Galaxy smartphone
------- Original message -------
From: [redacted] @bop.gov
Date: 7/30/19 3:20 PM (GMT-05:00)
To: [redacted] @bop.gov, Lee Plourde [redacted] @bop.gov
Subject: Re: Media inquiry - NY1 - re: Epstein hearing tomorrow
>> [redacted] 07/30/2019 15:20 >>>
FYI - Nancy Ayers is having me send this response to this reporter (in case you get similar inquiries):
Reporter: [redacted] NY1 News
Question: I hope this email finds you well. I'm reaching out regarding Jeffrey Epstein's hearing tomorrow. Can you please provide us with more information on the timing and if there are any expectations for tomorrow.
Response: Questions about a possible court hearing are best directed to an inmate's court of jurisdiction or legal counsel.
[redacted]
Public Information Office
Federal Bureau of Prisons
(202) 353-[redacted]
>>> [redacted] @charter.com 7/30/2019 12:17 PM >>>
Hi there,
I hope this email finds you well. I'm reaching out regarding Jeffrey Epstein's hearing tomorrow. Can you please provide us with more information on the timing and if there are any expectations for tomorrow.
Page 3401
DOJ-OGR-00023832

additional_notes: The document is an email chain with redactions. The redactions are likely due to privacy or security concerns.
